title: Rihanna Stuns in a Sheer, 2000s-Style Top at the "Smurfs" Global Premiere
description: Rihanna's groundbreaking pregnancy style is second to none. As if her first two pregnancy announcements weren't monumental enough, the Fenty empress debuted her third pregnancy at the 2025 Met Gala (before gracing the carpet), wearing a gray Miu Miu skirt set fresh off the runway. While making history as the first Barbadian entertainer, billionaire, and expectant mom to rock the Super Bowl halftime stage in 2023, she wore a red Loewe utility jumpsuit and vinyl bra plate - making for one of her most iconic fashion moments to date. "I'm not gonna buy maternity pants, jeans, dresses, or [do] whatever society told me to do before." Having worked with stylist Jahleel Weaver, she's produced many trendsetting street looks and jaw-dropping red carpet moments, including that vintage pink Chanel puffer coat and low-rise jeans combo that broke the internet as she unveiled her first baby bump with partner A$AP Rocky. The entrepreneur also established an unconventional pregnancy wardrobe that changed the narrative of what to wear while expecting. "It's been me personally saying, I'm not going to buy maternity clothes. I'm not gonna buy maternity pants, jeans, dresses, or [do] whatever society told me to do before," she told Bustle. "So, I challenged myself to push it further and really just have fun with [maternity style]. Because there's nothing more fun than a challenge for me." At this point, Rihanna has more than succeeded at rewriting dress codes, trading in loose-fitting maxi dresses and leggings for bump-baring silhouettes like crop tops, leather dresses, and shredded sets, inspiring stars such as Shay Mitchell to do the same. Ahead, shop Rihanna's maternity fashion essentials then keep scrolling to bask in her all-time, unfailing pregnancy style - starting with her iconic pregnancy announcement at the Met Gala.
author: Naomi Parris
excerpt: See Rihanna's groundbreaking pregnancy style and memorable fashion moments from both of her two pregnancies so far.
text: While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Her crop tops are a maternity fashion staple, whether she's wearing baggy jeans in Harlem or a high-slit skirt on the red carpet. This bestselling option from Free People features a scoop neck, '90s-style thin straps, and a snug fit.freepeople.comA CardiganFree People Free for All Cardi ($20, originally $58) If you're going to wear a cardigan, make it flirty. The pop star loves a cropped cardi with ties for buttons that allows her to show her stomach in the most stylish way possible. Style this playful printed top with low-rise denim to really Rihanna's off-duty, maternity-style look. revolve.comBaggy JeansGrlfrnd Luna Mid Rise Baggy Wide Leg Jeans ($221, originally $235) One of the most comfortable items in her maternity wardrobe, Rihanna loves to throw on a baggy pair of jeans with a tiny crop top or bra for the perfect balance of proportions. Grab a low-rise pair that sits just beneath your waistline and style it with everything from a bandeau to an abbreviated cardigan.Getty | Arnold JerockiRihanna Wearing a Sheer Top and Maxi SkirtRihanna was glowing at the "Smurfs" global premiere in a custom Chanel top with a sheer bodice and a matching skirt, embroidered with crystals, sequins, and feathers. The pop star championed showing off your bare belly with abbreviated or open blouses, and this look is no different. The bow on the back of the skirt was fashioned to look like the arms of a blazer, proving she pays attention to the Met Gala theme down to the smallest detail. The look featured a fuzzy, brown kangaroo-pouch pocket tube top, streamlined blue trousers with a frayed hem, and a brown faux-fur coat, accessorized with nude heels and gold jewelry.Getty | thecelebrityfinder/Bauer-GriffinRihanna Wearing a Loewe Striped Cropped PoloWhile on a lunch date with boyfriend A$AP Rocky, the Fenty mogul channeled the '90s in a Loewe striped, cropped polo with low-rise baggy jeans and Timberland boots. She accessorized with a box bag from Louis Vuitton's Fall 2022 menswear line, a middle-finger earring from Y/Project, and black sunglasses. Rocky also went casual with loose-fitting jeans, a trucker hat, and a red-and-blue plaid shirt layered underneath a Bottega Veneta vest.Vogue | Inez & VinoodhRihanna Wearing a Chanel Halter Dress on British VogueRihanna, Rocky, and their then 10-month-old baby boy graced British Vogue's March 2023 cover. Unknowingly pregnant at the time, the superstar wore a black Chanel halter-style gown with high slits and a bedazzled neckline, along with a diamond bangle. Rocky wore an all-leather vest and pants set with a chunky diamond necklace, and the baby stole hearts in a Chrome Hearts diaper cover.BackgridRihanna Wearing a Crop Top and a Patchwork Fur CoatRihanna gave us Y2K flashbacks when she paired a brown tie-front babydoll top with a patchwork animal-print-and-fur coat, a tie-dye Dior saddle bag, a camo hat, a vintage Briony Raymond ring, and Tom Ford sandals worn strapped over her low-slung jeans.BackgridRihanna Wearing All-Leather in Santa Monica, CAThe "Work" singer put her bump on full display while heading to dinner in a leather jacket, a microskirt, and a crystal bra top. She completed the look by layering a black Wardrobe NYC bomber jacket over a long white crystal-embellished button-down, adding even more glitz with a Balenciaga bag and Alexandre Vauthier heels.Naomi Parris is the assistant shopping editor at PS, based in New York. With over eight years of experience and previous roles held on the brand's Beauty and Operations teams, she enjoys telling stories that merge fashion, beauty, and Black culture. Naomi has also lent her skillful pen to Essence Girls United, Elle, Bustle, and Elite Daily. When she's not crafting shopping roundups, high-profile features, beauty op-eds, or trend guides, you can find Naomi behind her blog "Eli-Nay," where she inspires readers through style guides, cultural pieces, and innovative content on her Instagram.Jessica C. Andrews (she/her) is an award-winning editor and writer who works as the senior content director of PS Shopping. With more than 15 years of experience, her areas of expertise include fashion, shopping, and travel. Prior to joining PS, Jessica held senior roles at Teen Vogue, Refinery29, and Bustle and contributed to The New York Times, Elle, Vanity Fair, and Essence. She's appeared on "Good Morning America," NBC, and Fox 5 New York and spoken on various panels about fashion, hair, and Black culture.Victoria Messina was a senior editor on PS's Breaking News team. A University of Florida graduate with more than six years of digital media experience, she covers a range of topics, including TV shows and movies, celebrity style, rising stars, food trends, and just about any pop culture-adjacent subject in between.
html:
While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

Rihanna's groundbreaking pregnancy style is second to none. As if her first two pregnancy announcements weren't monumental enough, the Fenty empress debuted her third pregnancy at the 2025 Met Gala (before gracing the carpet), wearing a gray Miu Miu skirt set fresh off the runway. While making history as the first Barbadian entertainer, billionaire, and expectant mom to rock the Super Bowl halftime stage in 2023, she wore a red Loewe utility jumpsuit and vinyl bra plate — making for one of her most iconic fashion moments to date.

"I'm not gonna buy maternity pants, jeans, dresses, or [do] whatever society told me to do before."

Having worked with stylist Jahleel Weaver, she's produced many trendsetting street looks and jaw-dropping red carpet moments, including that vintage pink Chanel puffer coat and low-rise jeans combo that broke the internet as she unveiled her first baby bump with partner A$AP Rocky. The entrepreneur also established an unconventional pregnancy wardrobe that changed the narrative of what to wear while expecting. "It's been me personally saying, I'm not going to buy maternity clothes. I'm not gonna buy maternity pants, jeans, dresses, or [do] whatever society told me to do before," she told Bustle. "So, I challenged myself to push it further and really just have fun with [maternity style]. Because there's nothing more fun than a challenge for me."

At this point, Rihanna has more than succeeded at rewriting dress codes, trading in loose-fitting maxi dresses and leggings for bump-baring silhouettes like crop tops, leather dresses, and shredded sets, inspiring stars such as Shay Mitchell to do the same.

Ahead, shop Rihanna's maternity fashion essentials then keep scrolling to bask in her all-time, unfailing pregnancy style — starting with her iconic pregnancy announcement at the Met Gala.

A Crop Top

Free People Intimately FP Camisole ($20)

Rihanna doesn't shy away from showing off her growing belly, and in doing so, she gives other folks permission to do the same. Her crop tops are a maternity fashion staple, whether she's wearing baggy jeans in Harlem or a high-slit skirt on the red carpet. This bestselling option from Free People features a scoop neck, '90s-style thin straps, and a snug fit.

A Cardigan

Free People Free for All Cardi ($20, originally $58)

If you're going to wear a cardigan, make it flirty. The pop star loves a cropped cardi with ties for buttons that allows her to show her stomach in the most stylish way possible. Style this playful printed top with low-rise denim to really Rihanna's off-duty, maternity-style look.

Baggy Jeans

Grlfrnd Luna Mid Rise Baggy Wide Leg Jeans ($221, originally $235)

One of the most comfortable items in her maternity wardrobe, Rihanna loves to throw on a baggy pair of jeans with a tiny crop top or bra for the perfect balance of proportions. Grab a low-rise pair that sits just beneath your waistline and style it with everything from a bandeau to an abbreviated cardigan.

Rihanna Wearing a Sheer Top and Maxi Skirt

Rihanna was glowing at the "Smurfs" global premiere in a custom Chanel top with a sheer bodice and a matching skirt, embroidered with crystals, sequins, and feathers.

Rihanna Wearing Black Separates

Rihanna wowed at the A$AP Rocky x Ray Ban Met Gala after party in an unbuttoned ruffle top, a blazer, a maxiskirt, and a lace durag. The pop star championed showing off your bare belly with abbreviated or open blouses, and this look is no different.

Rihanna Wearing Marc Jacobs Suiting

Arguably the best-dressed star at the 2025 Met Gala, Rihanna's red-carpet-closing look included a cropped blazer, a corset, a slit-front skirt, a polka dot tie, and a top hat. The bow on the back of the skirt was fashioned to look like the arms of a blazer, proving she pays attention to the Met Gala theme down to the smallest detail.

Rihanna Wearing a Gray Miu Miu Set

Ahead of the 2025 Met Gala, Rihanna wore a gray skirt set from Miu Miu, paired with a black hat and coordinating shoes, to announce her third pregnancy.

Rihanna Wearing Her Savage X Fenty Sheer X Collection

To promote her Sheer X collection for Savage X Fenty that launched in July 2023, Rihanna was pictured in the red-pink demi spacer bra and thong panty, styled with hot-pink ankle-strap pumps for campaign imagery taken in front of rolls of fabric.

Rihanna Wearing a JW Anderson Furry Tube Top

For a night out in Paris with friend Melissa Forde, Rihanna stepped out in a look fresh off JW Anderson's Fall 2023 runway. The look featured a fuzzy, brown kangaroo-pouch pocket tube top, streamlined blue trousers with a frayed hem, and a brown faux-fur coat, accessorized with nude heels and gold jewelry.

Rihanna Wearing a Loewe Striped Cropped Polo

While on a lunch date with boyfriend A$AP Rocky, the Fenty mogul channeled the '90s in a Loewe striped, cropped polo with low-rise baggy jeans and Timberland boots. She accessorized with a box bag from Louis Vuitton's Fall 2022 menswear line, a middle-finger earring from Y/Project, and black sunglasses. Rocky also went casual with loose-fitting jeans, a trucker hat, and a red-and-blue plaid shirt layered underneath a Bottega Veneta vest.

Rihanna Wearing a Chanel Halter Dress on British Vogue

Rihanna, Rocky, and their then 10-month-old baby boy graced British Vogue's March 2023 cover. Unknowingly pregnant at the time, the superstar wore a black Chanel halter-style gown with high slits and a bedazzled neckline, along with a diamond bangle. Rocky wore an all-leather vest and pants set with a chunky diamond necklace, and the baby stole hearts in a Chrome Hearts diaper cover.

Rihanna Wearing a Crop Top and a Patchwork Fur Coat

Rihanna gave us Y2K flashbacks when she paired a brown tie-front babydoll top with a patchwork animal-print-and-fur coat, a tie-dye Dior saddle bag, a camo hat, a vintage Briony Raymond ring, and Tom Ford sandals worn strapped over her low-slung jeans.

Rihanna Wearing All-Leather in Santa Monica, CA

The "Work" singer put her bump on full display while heading to dinner in a leather jacket, a microskirt, and a crystal bra top. She accessorized with Coperni sunglasses, over-the-knee Amina Muaddi boots, Eéra and Repossi earrings, and silver necklaces by Nikos Koulis and Neil Lane.

Rihanna Wearing a Purple Gucci Fur Coat and a Latex Top

Rihanna hit up Gucci's fall 2022 runway show at Milan Fashion Week wearing several items by the luxury fashion house: a black latex crop top, dragon-motif pants, a purple faux-fur coat, and an intricate metallic headpiece. She completed the look with a Briony Raymond cross-pendant necklace and pumps by Amina Muaddi.

Rihanna Wearing a Purple Gucci Fur Coat and Crystal-Embellished Dress

Following Gucci's Milan Fashion Week presentation, she attended an afterparty in the same fuzzy purple coat but changed into a vintage dress with a keyhole cutout and crystal Gucci-logo embellishments. Lace-up sandals, Lang Antique necklaces, and a sparkly Gucci purse were the finishing touches.

Rihanna Wearing a Blue Cutout Stella McCartney Jumpsuit

Rihanna made us stop midscroll when she shared Instagram snaps in this aqua cutout jumpsuit and long jacket from Stella McCartney's summer 2022 collection. She layered a beige Stussy zip-up hoodie underneath and added turquoise Gucci sunglasses and Attico slingback pumps.

Rihanna Wearing a Sheer Dior Dress and a Leather Jacket

The soon-to-be mom wore one of her boldest looks at Dior's Paris Fashion Week show, pairing a sheer lace dress with a black leather coat, patent-leather Amina Muaddi boots, a Jacquie Aiche diamond bra, a diamond Neil Lane necklace, and cross and fleur-de-lis pendants by Chrome Hearts.

Rihanna Wearing a Bulls Jersey and a Saint Laurent Heart Coat

Rihanna resurrected her iconic heart-shaped Saint Laurent coat for a Nobu date night in February, layering it over a Chicago Bulls jersey, patch-covered Vetements pants, and zebra-print thong sandals by Amina Muaddi.

Rihanna Wearing a Mets Shirt and an R13 Bomber Jacket

While grabbing dinner in New York City with A$AP Rocky and her brother, Rihanna went for sporty vibes with a vintage Mets T-shirt, a brown R13 bomber jacket, rhinestone-covered Martine Rose jeans, a Dior choker, lace-up Amina Muaddi heels, a vintage Briony Raymond ring, and a chunky belt.

Rihanna Wearing a Shearling-Lined Y/Project Coat

Rihanna struck some poses for the 'gram in a brown shearling-lined Y/Project coat layered over a hoodie, jeans, and slouchy leather boots.

Rihanna Wearing a Sheer Jetpack Hom(m)e Blouse and Balenciaga Bomber

Rihanna showed her support for the Los Angeles Rams on Super Bowl Sunday with a navy-and-yellow Balenciaga bomber jacket, a tulle Jetpack Hom(m)e top, baggy Maison Margiela jeans, white Prada sunglasses, Attico slingback pumps, and necklaces by Briony Raymond and Fernando Jorge.

Rihanna Wearing a Graphic Hoodie and a Silver Skirt

Rihanna tucked away her bump in a graphic hoodie sweatshirt, a shearling-lined Walter Van Beirendonck jacket, a silver Attico miniskirt, a multicolor Fendi bag, Amina Muaddi sandals, and fringed Alessandra Rich earrings.

Rihanna Wearing a Tulle Simone Rocha Dress

A Hollywood shopping date with A$AP Rocky called for this breezy tulle-overlay Simone Rocha dress, which Rihanna paired with retro Air Jordan sneakers, a Gucci bag, and jewelry by Briony Raymond, Bulgari, Lang Antiques, and Patcharavipa.

Rihanna Wearing a Sheer Valentino Dress

Rihanna attended JAY-Z's Oscars party in LA wearing a shimmering Valentino gown with a sheer top and a flowing skirt. The mom-to-be paired the look with patent-leather heels, massive hoop earrings, rhinestone evening gloves, and long waves that stretched almost all the way down to her knees.

Rihanna Wearing an Alaïa Top and Boxers

Rihanna put comfort first when she paired a vintage floor-length Alaïa top with striped boxer shorts, bedazzled Nike sneakers, and a crystal-embellished Balenciaga bag.

Rihanna Wearing a Pink Bottega Veneta Bra Top and Vetements Jeans

Rihanna looked pretty in pink for a dinner outing in April. She wore a terry-cloth Bottega Veneta bralette, a tan R13 bomber jacket, a John Galliano vintage fox-fur stole, distressed Vetements jeans, and snakeskin Amina Muaddi pumps.

Rihanna Wearing a Crystal-Embellished Alexander Wang Button-Down

Another sweet blush-pink getup, this outfit combined a crystal-embellished Alexander Wang shirt worn unbuttoned with white drawstring shorts, a shiny Balenciaga bag, crystal-lined Miu Miu stockings, and fuzzy YSL mules.

Rihanna Wearing a Crystal-Embellished Miu Miu Set

One of her most striking maternity looks, this outfit layered a completely sheer Miu Miu skirt set over silky blue separates and included a leather belt, a gray faux-fur shawl, and crystal-adorned sandals.

Rihanna Wearing a Sequin Bikini and Skirt

Rihanna brought some serious glamour to the beaches of Barbados in this sequin Oséree bikini set and side-tie wrap skirt.

Rihanna Wearing a Sheer YSL Bra Top and Shorts

The singer attended her baby-shower dinner in a studded-logo YSL bra top and crystal-striped shorts. She completed the look by layering a black Wardrobe NYC bomber jacket over a long white crystal-embellished button-down, adding even more glitz with a Balenciaga bag and Alexandre Vauthier heels.

Naomi Parris is the assistant shopping editor at PS, based in New York. With over eight years of experience and previous roles held on the brand's Beauty and Operations teams, she enjoys telling stories that merge fashion, beauty, and Black culture. Naomi has also lent her skillful pen to Essence Girls United, Elle, Bustle, and Elite Daily. When she's not crafting shopping roundups, high-profile features, beauty op-eds, or trend guides, you can find Naomi behind her blog "Eli-Nay," where she inspires readers through style guides, cultural pieces, and innovative content on her Instagram.

Jessica C. Andrews (she/her) is an award-winning editor and writer who works as the senior content director of PS Shopping. With more than 15 years of experience, her areas of expertise include fashion, shopping, and travel. Prior to joining PS, Jessica held senior roles at Teen Vogue, Refinery29, and Bustle and contributed to The New York Times, Elle, Vanity Fair, and Essence. She's appeared on "Good Morning America," NBC, and Fox 5 New York and spoken on various panels about fashion, hair, and Black culture.

Victoria Messina was a senior editor on PS's Breaking News team. A University of Florida graduate with more than six years of digital media experience, she covers a range of topics, including TV shows and movies, celebrity style, rising stars, food trends, and just about any pop culture-adjacent subject in between.
